verses.plain: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

tokens.t: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

verses.plain: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!

tokens.t: As
the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries,
the nations may tremble at thy presence!

verses.plain: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

tokens.t: When thou didst terrible things
we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

verses.plain: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.

tokens.t: For since the beginning of the world
have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee,
he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.

verses.plain: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

tokens.t: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness,
remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

verses.plain: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

tokens.t: But we are all as an unclean
, and all our righteousnesses
as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

verses.plain: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.

tokens.t: And
none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.

verses.plain: But now, O LORD, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

tokens.t: But now, O
, thou
our father; we
the clay, and thou our potter; and we all
the work of thy hand.

verses.plain: ¶ Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

tokens.t: ¶ Be not wroth very sore, O
, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we
all thy people.

verses.plain: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

tokens.t: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

verses.plain: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.

tokens.t: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.

verses.plain: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O LORD? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?

, O
? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
